versos: (ships) Ezekiel 27:9 - The elders of Gebal and its skilled men were in you
(meaneth) John 6:63 - "It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you, they are spirit, and they are life.";;;

(gamaliel) Acts 5:34 - "But a Pharisee named gamaliel, a teacher of the law, who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a little while.";;;
(zidon) Joshua 19:29 - And then the coast turneth to Ramah, and to the strong city Tyre; and the coast turneth to Hosah; and the outgoings thereof are at the sea from the coast to Achzib.;;;
(strong) "The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and he helps me. My heart leaps for joy, and with my song I praise him." - Psalm 28:7 NIV;;;
(burdens) Matthew 11:28: "Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.";;;
(tribute) Romans 13:7 - "Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.";;;

(tribes) Revelation 5:5 - "Then one of the elders said to me, 'Do not weep See, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed. He is able to open the scroll and its seven seals.'";;;
(path) Psalm 16:11 - You make known to me the path of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence, with eternal pleasures at your right hand.;;;

(horse) Jeremiah 12:5 - "If you have raced with men on foot and they have worn you out, how can you compete with horses If you stumble in safe country, how will you manage in the thickets by the Jordan";;;
(rider) Job 39:18 - "when she paws in the valley and rejoices in her strength, she goes out to meet the weapons.";;;
(waited) Psalm 40:1 - "I waited patiently for the Lord; he turned to me and heard my cry.";;;
(overcome) 1 John 5:4 - For everyone born of God overcomes the world. This is the victory that has overcome the world
(loose) "And when he had thus spoken, he loosed their bonds, and let them go." - Acts 16:26;;;
(archers) Genesis 49:23 - The archers have bitterly grieved him
(manner) 1 Corinthians 15:32 - "If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.";;;
(wolf) Matthew 7:15 - "Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing but inwardly are ravenous wolves.";;;
